sentences.en: Arise in price will make people postpone expenditure.
sentences.cn: 价格的上升会使人们推迟支出.

sentences.en: At times, Congress moves quickly and explicitly to reverse or postpone a controversial agency action.
sentences.cn: 有时, 国会迅速明确地采取行动取消或延缓有争议的机关行动.

sentences.en: He proposed that we should postpone the trip.
sentences.cn: 他建议我们推迟这次旅行.

sentences.en: He said it was just not permissible to postpone the main issue by allowing business to carry on as usual.
sentences.cn: 他说决不允许因为日常工作而耽搁了重大问题。

sentences.en: His trial has been postponed indefinitely (= no one knows when it will happen ) .
sentences.cn: 对他的审判被无限期推迟了。

sentences.en: I had to postpone ideas of a career and stay at home.
sentences.cn: 我不得不暂缓就业打算，呆在家里。

sentences.en: I have to postpone our appointment.
sentences.cn: 我要把我们的约会延期.

sentences.en: I shall postpone making a decision till I learn full particulars.
sentences.cn: 在未获悉详情之前我得从缓作出决定.

sentences.en: I think we should postpone the outing.
sentences.cn: 我认为我们应该推迟这次郊游.

sentences.en: It is totally out of the question to postpone the midnight deadline.
sentences.cn: 想要推迟午夜的最后期限是完全不可能的。

sentences.en: It won't hurt to postpone the matter for a few days.
sentences.cn: 此事耽搁几天无所影响.

sentences.en: It won't hurt to postpone the meeting for a few more days.
sentences.cn: 会议再推迟几天也无妨.

sentences.en: She decided to postpone the converastion for that evening.
sentences.cn: 她决定当天晚上把谈话搁一搁.

sentences.en: She decided to postpone the conversation for that evening.
sentences.cn: 她决定把当天晚上的谈话搁一搁.

sentences.en: The committee judged it advisable to postpone the meeting.
sentences.cn: 委员会认为会议应该延期举行.

sentences.en: The match had to be postponed until next week.
sentences.cn: 比赛不得不推迟到下周举行。

sentences.en: There was an audible sigh of relief in Washington when the foreign ministers decided to postpone the meeting.
sentences.cn: 各国外长决定推迟会议后，华盛顿如释重负。

trans.tran_cn: 使…延期；把…放在次要地位；把…放在后面
trans.tran_en: to change the date or time of a planned event or action to a later one
